meta.name: description
meta.content: Isle of Wight County Schools serves K-12th grade and is located in Smithfield, VA.

div.p: Find all the latest updates and announcements on our website

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 703px; height: auto
div.p: Online enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year is expected to open May 4, 2020. Parents and guardians may complete the online enrollment at any point after that date. Once schools are reopened, school staff will contact parents/guardians who have completed the online forms. An appointment will be scheduled for them to bring documentation into the school and complete the enrollment process.

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 703px; height: auto

p.a: IWCS Announces 3rd Quarter ABCD Award Winner

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 703px; height: auto

p.a: Although our school buildings are closed, Isle of Wight County Schools is continuing to hire for the 2020--2021 school year. Principals and supervisors will be conducting virtual interviews during this time. For a listing of our vacant positions, please visit our Employment Page and click “Apply” to submit your online application.

a.b: Preschool applications for 2020-2021 are now being accepted!

a.b: Receive Connect 5 Information to Multiple Email Addresses and Manage Phone Numbers by Setting Up a Parent Portal Account

section.p: iPads will be distributed to students in grades K-5 on 4/29 and 4/30 at SMS and GTMS. Read the full article for more details.

h1.a: IWCS Budget Work Session on April 27

section.p: The School Board of Isle of Wight County will hold an FY21 Budget Work Session on Monday, April 27, 2020, at 9:00am in the cafeteria at Westside Elementary School, 800 West Main St., Smithfield, VA 23430. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss the FY21 School Division Operational Budget. The meeting will be streamed live through the division's Facebook and YouTube pages to allow for an audience while adhering to social distancing guidelines.

h1.a: Changes to Public Comments for May 14 Board Meeting

section.p: The Isle of Wight County School Board will hold their May 14 meeting in the cafeteria at Westside Elementary School. The meeting will be streamed live through the division's Facebook and YouTube page to allow for an audience while adhering to social distancing guidelines. The meeting will not have an opportunity for in-person public comment. However, anyone wishing to have remarks heard during the citizens comments section of the meeting can email their written comments to Tracey Reutt, Board Clerk, at treutt@iwcs.k12.va.us or mail their comments to Isle of Wight County School Board, 820 W. Main St., Smithfield, VA 23430 ATTN: Tracey Reutt. Mailed remarks must be received by Tuesday, the week of the board meeting. Emailed remarks must be received by noon the day of the meeting. Remarks are limited to five minutes per person.

The School Board of Isle of Wight County will hold a Closed School Board Meeting on Wednesday, April 22, 2020 at 8:45 a.m. in the Cafeteria at Westside Elementary School, 800 West Main Street, Smithfield, VA 23430. The purpose is to interview architects.

h1.a: IWCS Reading Coach Featured on VA TV Classroom

section.p: First Segment will air Monday, April 13 at 1pm on WHRO
